channel.title: Adding HTTP proxy to Tor Browser
channel.description:
What is best way to add local HTTP proxy to Tor Browser ? I noticed that i can't add proxy like in Firefox in network settings. I want to add burp (local http intercepting proxy).
Also can i just copy .tb folder and have another TorBrowser to experiment or i need to do something different in order to have second TorBrowser ?

item.title: Adding HTTP proxy to Tor Browser
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
howay:

What is best way to add local HTTP proxy to Tor Browser ?

Depends if local or remote proxy.

  • Accessing local web-interfaces.
  • Web HTTP(S)/SOCKS proxies have different instructions and will not work with these steps, see Tor Browser Proxy Configuration.

Related:

Whonix – 19 Jun 20

Combining Tunnels with Tor

Information on whether Tor gets more or less secure when combining Tor with tunnels such as VPN, SSH, proxies. (User → Tor → proxy/VPN/SSH → Internet) (User → proxy/VPN/SSH → Tor → Internet)

Whonix – 26 Jul 20

Connecting to Tor before a Proxy

Instructions on how to connect to Tor before a proxy (User → Tor → Proxy → Internet)

howay:

Also can i just copy .tb folder and have another TorBrowser to experiment or i need to do something different in order to have second TorBrowser ?

Yes, see:
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Whonix-Workstation_Security_Hardening#Multiple_Tor_Browser_Instances

easier and safer:

Whonix – 19 Jun 20

Multiple Whonix-Workstation ™

Compartmentalization. Better separation of different tasks and/or pseudonyms by using multiple Whonix-Workstation ™.
